channel.title: 667/7** bonus editor problem
channel.description:
soo i currently downloaded the item bonus packer from rune-server and when i run it im getting an unknown probem, is there anyone who can change the code, or figure out what the damn problem is? :/
@echo off title Bonuses Packer java -server -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/* com.rs.tools.ItemBonusesPacker pause
Problem
Press any key to continue. . .

item.description:

operable program or batch file
press any key to continue… everything your telling me isnt working… i look at other .bat files to maybe set it sorta like that but it doesnt work. and all my files are set in the right place[/quote]

are you running 64 bit windows? or 32 bit?

item.title: 667/7** bonus editor problem
item.dc:creator: @CPUsquad CPUsquad
item.description:
@CPUsquad wrote:

[quote=“xplode, post:5, topic:454124”]lol i have mine set the same exact way you set. i changed it from what i said before… this is what mine looks like

@echo off
title bonuses packer
C:/program files/java/jre7/java.exe -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/* com.rs.tools.itembonusespacker

my error now is

‘C:/program’ is not a recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
-.- no u dont… look closely… its "C:/Program Files… blah blah " … the “” are missing thats why it says not recognized…

Read full topic

item.title: 667/7** bonus editor problem
item.dc:creator: @CPUsquad CPUsquad
item.description:
@CPUsquad wrote:

[quote=“xplode, post:3, topic:454124”]soo

@echo off
title bonuses Packer
java -c:/program files/java/jre7/java.exe -xmx512 -cp bin;lib/* com.rs.tools.itembonusespacker
pase

does that look correct to you[/quote]

retard… do u not have any idea how windows works? wtf is java - c:/program files… (facepalm…)

just do this … java -xmx512 -cp blah blah… if that doesnt work then…

“C:/program files/java/jre7/java.exe” -xmx512 blah blah

pause

item.title: 667/7** bonus editor problem
item.dc:creator: @getsuga121 getsuga121
item.description:
@getsuga121 wrote:

i usally erase the -server part :L and replace

with “c:/program files/java/jre7/java.exe”

for x86 (me)
“c:/program files (x86)/java/jre7/java.exe”
